The AI Standards category describes national priorities in the field of AI standards developments by the respective national standardization institutes.au\/sites\/default\/ files\/June%202021\/document\/australias-ai-action-plan.au\/getmedia\/ede81912-55a2-4d8e-849f-9844993c3b9d\/1515-An-Artificial-Intelligence-Standards-Roadmap12-02-2020.au\/ getmedia\/aeaa5d9e-8911-4536-8c36-76733a3950d1\/Artificial-Intelligence-Discussion-Paper-(004).au\/report\/australian-strategy-quantum-revolution.eu\/en\/library\/ethics- guidelines-trustworthy-ai. eu\/legal-content\/EN\/TXT\/? uri=uriserv:OJ.eu\/EN\/EuropeanStandardization\/ Sectors\/AI\/CEN-CLC_FGR_RoadMapAI.eu\/en\/news\/adoption-council-regulation-establish-new-eurohpc-ju 314.jp\/press\/2020\/01\/20210115003\/20210115003-3.jp\/jp\/seisaku\/jinkouchinou\/pdf\/humancentricai.jp\/english\/policy\/economy\/chizai\/chiteki\/index.","url":"https:\/\/www.brookings.edu\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/10\/Strengthening-International-Cooperation-AI_Oct21.pdf","year":2021,"n_tokens":397,"source_id":"6464204b6c6c78bfcefedfd7","similarity":0.882158816,"similarity_to_answer":0.8338948601},"0":{"source":"Laura v2","country":"United States","title":"USA\/Strengthening-International-Cooperation-AI_Oct21\/104\/41","content":"80 The Cabinet Office Council on Industrial Competitiveness81 has targeted self- driving cars, drones, and production management, including smart factories, all powered by AI, as key opportunities to increase Japan\u2019s productivity. Public Japanese research institutes such as the National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST) and Institute of Physical and Chemical Research the Institute of Physical and Chemical Research (RIKEN) also contribute to AI innovation by establishing new R&D centers to speed up technological advancements in relation to AI technology. 30 Japan describes its \u201cideal approach to AI governance\u201d as a set of \u201cnon- binding intermediate goal-based guidelines to promote AI innovation and deployment\u201d. 82 Under the approach, risk management should be commensurate with the context and size of an organization and \u201clegally-binding horizontal requirements for AI systems are deemed unnecessary at the moment\u201d. 83 Pursuant to this approach, the government has issued a number of guidelines to guide AI stakeholders including researchers, businesses, and the public: R&D Guidelines (2018),84 Social Principles of Human-Centric AI (2019),85 and AI Utilization Guidelines (2019). 86 The AI R&D Guidelines and AI Utilization Guidelines have contributed significantly to the development of international AI policy frameworks, most notably the international OECD AI Principles. 87 Japan\u2019s Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) puts the Japan\u2019s AI principles at the core of their strategic objective to advance international cooperation on AI and digital technologies more generally. Picking up where Canada\u2019s presidency left off, Japan\u2019s G-7 presidency was instrumental in the launch of GPAI. Likewise, the further development of Japan\u2019s Data Free Flow with Trust (DFFT) framework, which enables multilateral data transfers between countries, was a focus of the G-7 in the Japanese presidency.","url":"https:\/\/www.brookings.edu\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/10\/Strengthening-International-Cooperation-AI_Oct21.pdf","year":2021,"n_tokens":366,"source_id":"6464204b6c6c78bfcefedfd7","similarity":0.88556844,"similarity_to_answer":0.8269621559},"1":{"source":"Orsolya","country":"OECD","title":"OECD\/Artificial Intelligence in Society\/9\/130","content":"At the G7 ICT Ministerial meeting in Takamatsu in April 2016, Japan proposed the formulation of shared principles for AI R&D. A group of experts called Conference toward AI Network Society developed Draft AI R&D Guidelines for International Discussions, which were published by the Japanese Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications in July 2017. These guidelines seek primarily to balance benefits and risks of AI networks, while ensuring technological neutrality and avoiding excessive burden on developers. The guidelines consist of nine principles that researchers and developers of AI systems should consider (Japan, 2017[29]). Table 5.2 provides the abstract of the guidelines. The Conference published the Draft AI Utilization Principles in July 2018 as an outcome of the discussion (Japan, 2018[30]). Pay attention to the interconnectivity and interoperability of AI systems. Pay attention to the verifiability of inputs\/outputs of AI systems and explainability of their decisions. Pay attention to the controllability of AI systems. Ensure that AI systems do not harm the life, body or property of users or third parties through actuators or other devices. Pay attention to the security of AI systems. Take into consideration that AI systems will not infringe the privacy of users or third parties. Respect human dignity and individual autonomy in R&D of AI systems. Take into consideration that AI systems will support users and make it possible to give them opportunities for choice in appropriate manners. Make efforts to fulfil their accountability to stakeholders, including users of AI systems. The Korean government published the Intelligent Information Industry Development Strategy in March 2016. It announced public investment of KRW 1 trillion (USD 940 million) by 2020 in the field of AI and related information technologies such as IoT and cloud computing.","url":"https:\/\/www.oecd-ilibrary.org\/deliver\/eedfee77-en.pdf?itemId=%2Fcontent%2Fpublication%2Feedfee77-en&mimeType=pdf","year":2021,"n_tokens":358,"source_id":"64642dad6c6c78bfcefef932","similarity":0.883110285,"similarity_to_answer":0.8257876648}}

 '80 The Cabinet Office Council on Industrial Competitiveness81 has targeted self- driving cars, drones, and production management, including smart factories, all powered by AI, as key opportunities to increase Japan‚Äôs productivity. Public Japanese research institutes such as the National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST) and Institute of Physical and Chemical Research the Institute of Physical and Chemical Research (RIKEN) also contribute to AI innovation by establishing new R&D centers to speed up technological advancements in relation to AI technology. 30 Japan describes its ‚Äúideal approach to AI governance‚Äù as a set of ‚Äúnon- binding intermediate goal-based guidelines to promote AI innovation and deployment‚Äù. 82 Under the approach, risk management should be commensurate with the context and size of an organization and ‚Äúlegally-binding horizontal requirements for AI systems are deemed unnecessary at the moment‚Äù. 83 Pursuant to this approach, the government has issued a number of guidelines to guide AI stakeholders including researchers, businesses, and the public: R&D Guidelines (2018),84 Social Principles of Human-Centric AI (2019),85 and AI Utilization Guidelines (2019). 86 The AI R&D Guidelines and AI Utilization Guidelines have contributed significantly to the development of international AI policy frameworks, most notably the international OECD AI Principles. 87 Japan‚Äôs Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) puts the Japan‚Äôs AI principles at the core of their strategic objective to advance international cooperation on AI and digital technologies more generally. Picking up where Canada‚Äôs presidency left off, Japan‚Äôs G-7 presidency was instrumental in the launch of GPAI. Likewise, the further development of Japan‚Äôs Data Free Flow with Trust (DFFT) framework, which enables multilateral data transfers between countries, was a focus of the G-7 in the Japanese presidency.'

['Orsolya' 'OECD' 'OECD/Artificial Intelligence in Society/9/130'
 'At the G7 ICT Ministerial meeting in Takamatsu in April 2016, Japan proposed the formulation of shared principles for AI R&D. A group of experts called Conference toward AI Network Society developed Draft AI R&D Guidelines for International Discussions, which were published by the Japanese Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications in July 2017. These guidelines seek primarily to balance benefits and risks of AI networks, while ensuring technological neutrality and avoiding excessive burden on developers. The guidelines consist of nine principles that researchers and developers of AI systems should consider (Japan, 2017[29]). Table 5.2 provides the abstract of the guidelines. The Conference published the Draft AI Utilization Principles in July 2018 as an outcome of the discussion (Japan, 2018[30]). Pay attention to the interconnectivity and interoperability of AI systems. Pay attention to the verifiability of inputs/outputs of AI systems and explainability of their decisions. Pay attention to the controllability of AI systems. Ensure that AI systems do not harm the life, body or property of users or third parties through actuators or other devices. Pay attention to the security of AI systems. Take into consideration that AI systems will not infringe the privacy of users or third parties. Respect human dignity and individual autonomy in R&D of AI systems. Take into consideration that AI systems will support users and make it possible to give them opportunities for choice in appropriate manners. Make efforts to fulfil their accountability to stakeholders, including users of AI systems. The Korean government published the Intelligent Information Industry Development Strategy in March 2016. It announced public investment of KRW 1 trillion (USD 940 million) by 2020 in the field of AI and related information technologies such as IoT and cloud computing.'
 'https://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/deliver/eedfee77-en.pdf?itemId=%2Fcontent%2Fpublication%2Feedfee77-en&mimeType=pdf'
